definition: the Doctrine of the Mean, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1]
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
doctrine of the mean/moderation in all things

sentences.english: We need to have a happy medium between being too close and too distant to our friends.
sentences.chinese: 对待朋友应在过分亲近与过分疏远中，选择中庸之道。

sentences.english: The mean is an important intension of the Confucian school.
sentences.chinese: 中庸是儒家思想中的一个重要内容。

sentences.english: Among them, integrity harmony is the most essential characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 其中，整体和谐性是中庸之道最本质的特征。

sentences.english: Discussion on justice of the mean by Confucius;
sentences.chinese: 中庸是儒家思想的一个重要组成部分。

sentences.english: Confucius has said succinctly with a "too far" to be summarized middle ground.
sentences.chinese: 孔子曾简洁地以一句“过犹不及”来概括中庸之道。

sentences.english: The Chinese often praise Liu and the basketball star Yao Ming for their modesty.
sentences.chinese: 中国人经常赞美刘翔和姚明为他们中庸之道的代言人。

sentences.english: Can we cut out the middle-man?
sentences.chinese: 能把中庸人士剔除团队吗？
这里有一种中庸的文化。

sentences.english: The " in-between" will fade from your view.
sentences.chinese: 骑墙中庸的状态将从你的视野中退出。

sentences.english: Many Chinese people believe in happy medium as a philosophy of life.
sentences.chinese: 许多中国人相信中庸之道，以此为人生哲学。

sentences.english: That's why Confucian advocates middlebrow and tolerance, namely, following humanity and morality, doing things in medium manner.
sentences.chinese: 所以儒家讲中庸和包容，即恪守仁道，无过无不及。

sentences.english: They advanced the theory of the mean in similar historical background.
sentences.chinese: 在相似的历史背景下，他们提出了“中庸”思想。

sentences.english: I have found that keeping a happy medium is the best way of life.
sentences.chinese: 我发觉生活中能保持中庸之道，才是最上策。

sentences.english: Golden mean in Confucianism is the ideology of fathering and managing enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 儒家的中庸之道是我治理和经营企业的理念。

sentences.english: In a conservative company, cultures may evolve that accept mediocrity.
sentences.chinese: 在保守公司里，文化可能演变成了中庸之道盛行。

sentences.english: Between Zhongyong and Xingzimingchu, there're also many similarities.
sentences.chinese: 《中庸》和《性自命出》篇也非常相似。

definition: doctrine of the mean/moderation in all things
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
kindhearted and moderate (idiom); temperate and gentle
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Confucian thoughts/the thinking of the Confucian school
Fangzheng county in Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Heilongjiang
